meanings.definition: Involving unnecessary repetition of an idea, statement, or word.
meanings.sent1: Her tautological explanation made the topic confusing.
meanings.sent2: The tautological speech bored the audience with its constant repetition.
meanings.sent3: The tautological debate went on and on, saying the same thing in different ways.
meanings.sent4: His writing style was tautological, like a broken record stuck on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The tautological nature of his argument made it hard to follow.

meanings.definition: Characterized by tautology; redundant or repetitive in nature.
meanings.sent1: The tautological reasoning in his essay weakened his argument.
meanings.sent2: Her tautological behavior annoyed her friends who grew tired of hearing the same stories.
meanings.sent3: The tautological pattern of his jokes made them predictable but still funny.
meanings.sent4: The tautological design of the building gave it a sense of symmetry and balance.
meanings.sent5: The tautological structure of the song's lyrics added to its catchy rhythm.
